questiontext.text:
Exercise

Write out the terms of the Fourier series for the periodic signal given by \[ f(t) = \begin{cases} 0 \hspace{1cm} -\pi < t < 0\\ t^2 \hspace{1cm} 0 < t < \pi \end{cases} \] \[ f(t + 2\pi) = f(t).\] You should give the constant term \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) and each term corresponding to \( n = 1\) to \( n = 3\):

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Since \(T = 2\pi\) and since the function has a non-zero average value, the form of the Fourier series is \[ \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{n=1}^\infty \left\{ a_n \cos (n t) + b_n \sin (n t) \right\} \] where \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^{2\pi} }f(t) \cos (n t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 0, 1, 2, \dots \\ b_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^{2\pi} } f(t) \sin (n t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 2, \dots \end{align} \] Because the function is non-negative there will be a constant term. The constant term will be \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) where \( a_0 = \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\pi}} t^2 \hspace{0.15cm}dt = \dfrac{\pi^2}{3} \).

For \(n = 1, 2, 3, \dots , \) we have \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\pi} } t^2 \cos (n\pi t) \hspace{0.15cm} dt \\ &=\dfrac{1}{\pi} \left\{ \left[ \dfrac{t^2}{n} \sin (n t) \right] _{0}^{\pi} - \dfrac{2}{n} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\pi} } t \sin n t \hspace{0.15cm} dt \right\}\\ &= - \dfrac{2}{n\pi} \left\{ \left[ - \dfrac{t}{n} \cos n \pi t \right] _{0}^\pi + \dfrac{1}{n} \displaystyle{ \int_{0}^{\pi} } \cos n t \hspace{0.15cm} dt \right\} \\ &= -\dfrac{2}{n\pi} \left\{ -\dfrac{\pi}{n} \cos n\pi + \dfrac{1}{n^2} \left[ \sin n t \right]_{0}^\pi \right\} \\ &= \dfrac{2}{n^2} \cos n\pi \\ &= \begin{cases} -\dfrac{2}{n^2} \hspace{1cm} n = 1,3,5, \dots\\ \dfrac{2}{n^2} \hspace{1cm} n = 2,4,6, \dots \end{cases} \end{align} \] Similarly for \(b_n\) we have \[ b_n = \begin{cases} -\dfrac{\pi}{n} \hspace{1cm} n = 2,4,6, \dots\\ \dfrac{\pi}{n} - \dfrac{4}{n^3\pi} \hspace{1cm} n = 1,3,5, \dots\\ \end{cases} \]

Thus the series is given by \[ \begin{align} f(t) &= \dfrac{\pi^2}{6} - 2 \cos t + \dfrac{1}{2} \cos 2t - \dfrac{2}{9} \cos 3t \dots \\ &+ \left( \pi - \dfrac{4}{\pi} \right) \sin t - \dfrac{\pi}{2} \sin 2t + \left( \dfrac{\pi}{3} - \dfrac{4}{9\pi} \right) \sin 3t + \dots \end{align} \]
